intro: Tarenna adangensis, commonly known as the Adangensis Tarenna, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, dark berries as fruit. Tarenna adangensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
